speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: SCENE I. Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRA's palace.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Enter DEMETRIUS and PHILO

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Nay, but this dotage of our general's

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: O'erflows the measure: those his goodly eyes,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: That o'er the files and musters of the war

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Have glow'd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The office and devotion of their view

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Upon a tawny front: his captain's heart,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: And is become the bellows and the fan

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: To cool a gipsy's lust.

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Look, where they come:

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Take but good note, and you shall see in him.

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The triple pillar of the world transform'd

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Into a strumpet's fool: behold and see.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: There's beggary in the love that can be reckon'd.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I'll set a bourn how far to be beloved.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter an Attendant

speaker: Attendant
text_entry: News, my good lord, from Rome.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Grates me: the sum.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Nay, hear them, Antony:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Fulvia perchance is angry; or, who knows

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If the scarce-bearded Caesar have not sent

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: His powerful mandate to you, 'Do this, or this;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Perform 't, or else we damn thee.'

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How, my love!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Perchance! nay, and most like:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: You must not stay here longer, your dismission

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is come from Caesar; therefore hear it, Antony.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Where's Fulvia's process? Caesar's I would say? both?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Call in the messengers. As I am Egypt's queen,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou blushest, Antony; and that blood of thine

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is Caesar's homager: else so thy cheek pays shame

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: When shrill-tongued Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of the ranged empire fall! Here is my space.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Kingdoms are clay: our dungy earth alike

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Feeds beast as man: the nobleness of life

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Is to do thus; when such a mutual pair

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Embracing

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And such a twain can do't, in which I bind,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: On pain of punishment, the world to weet

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We stand up peerless.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Excellent falsehood!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I'll seem the fool I am not; Antony

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Will be himself.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: But stirr'd by Cleopatra.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Now, for the love of Love and her soft hours,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let's not confound the time with conference harsh:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: There's not a minute of our lives should stretch

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Hear the ambassadors.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Fie, wrangling queen!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whom every thing becomes, to chide, to laugh,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To weep; whose every passion fully strives

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To make itself, in thee, fair and admired!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: No messenger, but thine; and all alone

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To-night we'll wander through the streets and note

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The qualities of people. Come, my queen;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Last night you did desire it: speak not to us.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with their train

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Is Caesar with Antonius prized so slight?

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Sir, sometimes, when he is not Antony,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: He comes too short of that great property

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Which still should go with Antony.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: I am full sorry

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: That he approves the common liar, who

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Thus speaks of him at Rome: but I will hope

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Of better deeds to-morrow. Rest you happy!

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
